summary: A more literal translation of Will Farrington's Twilight color theme
name: vilight.vim
description:
A big fan of the gedit color theme 'Twilight' by Will Farrington, I made a pretty literal translation of it for vim here ( I did borrow Yoshi Nima's excellent status bar coloring from his theme also named 'twilight'). The only changes from Farrington's scheme is that I did away with the 'dark maroon' guibg and added Pmenu colors.

Screenshots here => "http://robrobbins.info/?page_id=2"
install_details: Just drop into .vim/colors. I haven't made terminal compatible modes yet, so it only looks proper in gvim. If you have any term prefs in your .vimrc (like I had t_co=256) comment them out if you plan to launch from a terminal window or the colors may be incorrect (I notice this on my linux box. I'm going to update with terminal compat modes soon - rob)

versions.release_notes:
A few tweaks from my current working version such as:
1. Italics for comments and folds
2. underlines for errors to increse visibility
3. and more...;)
(Corrected an error from this mornings uploaded version with 1.3.1)
